user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of print_perf_warnings:
```c
static void
print_perf_warnings (void)
{
  int newline_needed = 0;
#if defined (_DEBUG)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: Running with debug asserts enabled, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && ! defined (__OPTIMIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled without enabled compiler "
           "optimisations, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined (__OPTIMIZE_SIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (MHD_NO != MHD_is_feature_supported (MHD_FEATURE_DEBUG_BUILD))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The libmicrohttpd is compiled with "
             "debug asserts enabled, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
    newline_needed |=  ! 0;
  }
#endif /* MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701 */
  if (newline_needed)
    printf ("\n");
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined (__OPTIMIZE_SIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
explanation: I selected all conditional-preprocessor and runtime-conditional fragments that can affect reachability: each #if / #endif block and the final if (newline_needed) printf are the places where code may be excluded at compile-time or never executed at run-time. Other parts of the function are not reported because they are ordinary, reachable constructs or simple declarations that do not themselves create unreachable code: the function signature and opening/closing braces, the local variable declaration and initialization (int newline_needed = 0;), and the use of newline_needed as a variable are standard and do not by themselves constitute unreachable statements. No other standalone statements in the function create obvious compile-time or run-time unreachability beyond the conditional blocks listed above.
